alert.note: Alert for Carter (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 9:02AM CDT until July 12 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall will continue. * WHERE...Portions of east central, southeast, and southern Oklahoma, including the following counties, in east central Oklahoma, Pontotoc. In southeast Oklahoma, Coal and Johnston. In southern Oklahoma, Carter, Garvin and Murray. * WHEN...Until 100 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 902 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing in the warned area. Between 2.5 and 6 inches of rain have fallen, mainly during the overnight hours. As water continues to recede this morning, most of the flooding will be along creeks, streams and flood prone areas. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ada, Sulphur, Davis, Wynnewood, Roff, Springer, Ravia, Stonewall, Mill Creek, Fitzhugh, Dougherty, Bromide, Gene Autry, Hickory, Scullin, Lake Of The Arbuckles, Reagan, Connerville, Pontotoc and Vanoss. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
